alert.note: Alert for Carbon (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 8:50PM MDT until further notice by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Wyoming... Little Snake River near Dixon and at Baggs affecting Carbon County. .Snowmelt will cause rises on the Little Snake River this week. Rainfall may add to the rises. For the Little Snake River near Dixon and at Baggs...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor to moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Little Snake River near Dixon and at Baggs. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.5 feet, Moderate flooding occurs in many areas throughout the town of Baggs. Moderate to major lowland flooding occurs from Dixon to Baggs. Flood wave travel time to Baggs is approximately 2 to 3 hours. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Forecast...The river will rise to Moderate flood stage with a maximum value of 10.5 feet Monday morning. It will fall to just below 10 feet Monday evening, but repeated rises each morning to near Moderate flood stage are expected Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday mornings this week. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.4 feet on 06/06/1995. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Little Snake River Little Snake River near Dixon 9.5 MSG unknown 10.5 10.3 10.4 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday afternoon at 1200 PM MDT.
